incidents.name: Delays in Inbound/Outbound Voice Over Interconnect and Elastic SIP Trunking in Ashburn (US1) and Time Outs in MMS

incident_updates.body: The issue has been fully resolved. Inbound/Outbound calls connecting to our Ashburn (US-1) edge location interconnecting for Voice (both SDK and SIP), Elastic SIP Trunking and MMS & SMS messages from Twilio Long Code and Toll Free are working normally. Customers who moved off US-1 may move their traffic back to US-1 at any time.

We have started seeing recovery for inbound/Outbound calls connecting to our Ashburn (US1) edge location interconnecting for Voice (both SDK and SIP), Elastic SIP Trunking and around 10% of MMS messages from Twilio Long Code and Toll Free. Clusters have been restored and currently being monitored to ensure a full recovery. We expect to provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We have started seeing recovery for inbound/Outbound calls connecting to our Ashburn (US1) edge location interconnecting for Voice (both SDK and SIP), Elastic SIP Trunking and around 10% of MMS messages from Twilio Long Code and Toll Free. Clusters have been restored and currently being monitored to ensure a full recovery. We expect to provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We have started seeing recovery for inbound/Outbound calls connecting to our Ashburn (US1) edge location interconnecting for Voice (both SDK and SIP), Elastic SIP Trunking and around 10% of MMS messages from Twilio Long Code and Toll Free. Clusters have been restored and currently being monitored to ensure a full recovery. We expect to provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We have started seeing recovery for inbound/Outbound calls connecting to our Ashburn (US1) edge location interconnecting for Voice (both SDK and SIP), Elastic SIP Trunking and around 10% of MMS messages from Twilio Long Code and Toll Free. Clusters have been restored and currently being monitored to ensure a full recovery. We expect to provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We have started seeing recovery for inbound/Outbound calls connecting to our Ashburn (US1) edge location interconnecting for Voice (both SDK and SIP), Elastic SIP Trunking and around 10% of MMS messages from Twilio Long Code and Toll Free. Clusters have been restored and currently being monitored to ensure a full recovery. We expect to provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We have started seeing recovery for inbound/Outbound calls connecting to our Ashburn (US1) edge location interconnecting for Voice (both SDK and SIP), Elastic SIP Trunking and around 10% of MMS messages from Twilio Long Code and Toll Free. Clusters have been restored and currently being monitored to ensure a full recovery. We expect to provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

Customers connecting to our Ashburn (US1) edge location interconnecting for Voice (both SDK and SIP), Elastic SIP Trunking and around 10% of MMS messages from Twilio Long Code and Toll Free may experience timeouts and one-way audio calls getting delayed with one-way audio. Customers connecting via Twilio Interconnect to our US East Coast (Virginia) edge location can avoid the problem by routing their traffic to either our US West Coast (San Jose) edge location (which they would have had to purchase) or any of our public Internet edges. This impacts SIP Interfaces, Client Web and Elastic SIP Trunking. We will provide another update in 16 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

Customers connecting to our Ashburn (US1) edge location interconnecting for Voice (both SDK and SIP), Elastic SIP Trunking and around 10% of MMS messages from Twilio Long Code and Toll Free may experience timeouts and one-way audio calls getting delayed with one-way audio. Customers connecting via Twilio Interconnect to our US East Coast (Virginia) edge location can avoid the problem by routing their traffic to either our US West Coast (San Jose) edge location (which they would have had to purchase) or any of our public Internet edges. This impacts SIP Interfaces, Client Web and Elastic SIP Trunking. We will provide another update in 16 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

Customers connecting to our Ashburn (US1) edge location interconnecting for Voice (both SDK and SIP), Elastic SIP Trunking and around 10% of MMS messages from Twilio Long Code and Toll Free may experience timeouts and one-way audio calls getting delayed with one-way audio. Customers connecting via Twilio Interconnect to our US East Coast (Virginia) edge location can avoid the problem by routing their traffic to either our US West Coast (San Jose) edge location (which they would have had to purchase) or any of our public Internet edges. This impacts SIP Interfaces, Client Web and Elastic SIP Trunking. We will provide another update in 8 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

Customers connecting to our Ashburn (US1) edge location interconnecting for Voice (both SDK and SIP), Elastic SIP Trunking and around 10% of MMS messages from Twilio Long Code and Toll Free may experience timeouts and one-way audio calls getting delayed with one-way audio. PSTN delays have been mitigated. We will provide another update in 4 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

Customers connecting to our Ashburn (US1) edge location Interconnecting for Voice (both SDK and SIP) and Elastic SIP Trunking may experience timeouts and one-way audio which includes PSTN calls getting delayed with one-way audio. We will provide another update in 4 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

Customers connecting to our Ashburn (US1) edge location Interconnecting for Voice (both SDK and SIP) and Elastic SIP Trunking may experience timeouts and one-way audio which includes PSTN calls getting delayed with one-way audio. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

Customers connecting to our Ashburn (US1) edge location Interconnecting for Voice (both SDK and SIP) and Elastic SIP trunking may experience timeouts and one-way audio which includes PSTN calls getting delayed with one-way audio. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.
Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with Voice product. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

incidents.name: Connectivity Lost on 10% of Super SIM Devices

incident_updates.body: Connectivity losses in Super SIM Devices have been restored and Super SIM Devices are operating normally at this time.

We are now seeing recovery of the Super SIM connectivity issues. We are continuing to monitor for service stability. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

While attempting to restore all Twilio services to normal, we made a configuration change at our datacenter modifying how some traffic between Twilio's Mobile Core and our carrier partners is handled at 2:16 PM PT. This may have created some delays or prevented devices from connecting in a small number of countries. The most notable impact observed by Twilio was in New Zealand. At ~8:00 PM PT, the issue was identified and we temporarily blocked attachments on the impacted connectivity partner in New Zealand. SIMs failing to connect should have failed over to backup IMSIs on the SIMs allowing them to reconnect via an alternative connectivity partner. At ~9:00 PM PT, the configuration change was reverted and we re-enabled the blocked connectivity partner in New Zealand. Impact in other countries not identified by Twilio should have subsided after the configuration change was reverted. We'll provide another update in 16 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

The transfer of traffic between nodes within our datacenter has completed. During the process, we observed 7% of active data sessions on Super SIM being dropped. Devices that attempted to reconnect immediately after losing connectivity should have been able to successfully reconnect to the new node. Our team is actively working to restore the service completely.  We'll provide another update in 16 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

The transfer of traffic between nodes within our datacenter has completed. During the process, we observed 7% of active data sessions on Super SIM being dropped. Devices that attempted to reconnect immediately after losing connectivity should have been able to successfully reconnect to the new node. Our team is actively working to restore the service completely.  We'll provide another update in 8 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

Twilio engineering is planning to move traffic between nodes within our datacenter as part of the ongoing emergency maintenance at 12:15 PM PT. Super SIM data connectivity is expected to be impacted to a similar degree as the 8:15am PT drop when a similar event occurred. We'll provide another update in 8 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

Twilio engineering is continuing to work with our datacenter partners to restore all Twilio services. We are monitoring for any changes in traffic patterns in our datacenter that may result in a temporary drop in data session connectivity. We'll provide another update in 4 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

During the emergency maintenance we observed 10% of active data sessions on Super SIM being dropped as they might have lost data connectivity at 8:15 AM PT. The drop was caused by moving traffic back to primary datacenter hardware to which the latest update has been applied. Devices that attempted to reconnect immediately after losing connectivity should have been able to successfully reconnect to the new node. Our team is actively working to restore the service completely. We'll provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

During the emergency maintenance we observed 10% of active data sessions on Super SIM being dropped as they might have lost data connectivity at 8:15 AM PT. The drop was caused by moving traffic back to primary datacenter hardware to which the latest update has been applied. Devices that attempted to reconnect immediately after losing connectivity should have been able to successfully reconnect to the new node. Our team is actively working to restore the service completely. We'll provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

During the emergency maintenance we observed 10% of active data sessions on Super SIM being dropped as they might have lost data connectivity. The drop was due to a failover operation required to re-establish connectivity in one of our data centers. Devices that attempted to reconnect immediately after losing connectivity should have been able to successfully reconnect to the redundant instances while the impacted one recovered. Our team is actively working to restore the service completely. We'll provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

During the emergency maintenance we observed 10% of active data sessions on Super SIM being dropped as they might have lost data connectivity. The drop was due to a failover operation required to re-establish connectivity in one of our data centers. Devices that attempted to reconnect immediately after losing connectivity should have been able to successfully reconnect to the redundant instances while the impacted one recovered. Our team is actively working to restore the service completely. We'll provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We have identified the cause of the Super SIM connectivity issues. Our team has determined that the problem stems from a network node malfunction. To address this issue, the emergency maintenance is in progress. During this maintenance, there may be temporary connectivity loss for some devices. We apologise for any inconvenience this may cause. We'll provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We have identified the cause of the Super SIM connectivity issues. Our team has determined that the problem stems from a network node malfunction. To address this issue, we will be conducting an emergency maintenance within the next hour, beginning at 2 am PT. During this maintenance, there may be temporary connectivity loss for some devices. We apologize for any inconvenience this may cause. We'll provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our engineers have observed 10% of active data sessions on Super SIM being dropped at 1:15 PT. Devices that attempted to reconnect immediately after losing connectivity should have been able to successfully reconnect to the redundant instances while the impacted one recovered. We will continue to monitor for system stability. We'll provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

Beginning at 1:45 am PT, we observed 12% of active data sessions on Super SIM being dropped. Devices that attempted to reconnect immediately after losing connectivity should have been able to successfully reconnect to the redundant instances while the impacted one recovered. We will continue to monitor and expect to provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

Beginning at 1:45 am PT, we observed 12% of active data sessions on Super SIM being dropped. Devices that attempted to reconnect immediately after losing connectivity should have been able to successfully reconnect to the redundant instances while the impacted one recovered. We will continue to monitor and expect to provide another update in 30 minutes or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with Super Sim Sessions Drop. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

incidents.name: 5xx Errors From Flex

incident_updates.body: We are no longer experiencing 5xx Errors from Flex. This incident has been resolved.

Flex was degraded for 15 minutes between 17:20  and 17:35 Pacific Time on 02/20/2023 and some agents may have experienced issues logging into Flex. We will continue monitoring the service to ensure a full recovery. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.
Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with Flex. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.
